item.title: The Migratory Bird Treaty Act and bird conservation
item.description: Last December, a team led by scientist Tatsuya Amano from the University of Oxfordâ€™s Conservation Science Group published an important paper on waterbird conservation. Using data collected across the globe, they examined population changes over the past 3 decades in 461 species of waterbird, including everything from ducks to shorebirds to flamingos. During this time, waterbirds in some parts of the world thrived, but in other places they experienced steep declines.
